00051 
00052 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(const unsigned long m0, 
00053                                               const unsigned long m1)
00054 {
00055     return (unsigned long long) m0 * m1;
00056 }
00057 
00058 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00059                                                const unsigned long uld,
00060                                                unsigned long *const rp)
00061 {
00062     const unsigned long r = ull % uld;
00063     ull /= uld;
00064 
00065     if (rp)
00066         *rp = r;
00067 
00068     return ull;
00069 }
00070 
00071 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00072 
00073 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00074 
00075     /* Returns (int)i = (unsigned long long)i*(u_long)(mult)/(u_long)div. */
00076     const unsigned long long ull = rthal_ullmul(i, mult);
00077     return rthal_uldivrem(ull, div, NULL);
00078 }
00079 
00080 static inline __attribute_const__
00081 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00082                                    const unsigned long m,
00083                                    const unsigned long d)
00084 {
00085         return (op*m)/d;
00086 }
00087 
00088 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00089                                      unsigned long m,
00090                                      unsigned long d)
00091 {
00092 
00093     if(op < 0LL)
00094         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00095     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00096 }
00097 
00098 static inline  __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00099 
00100     __asm__ ("cntlzd %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00101     return 63 - ul;
00102 }

00119 static inline unsigned long long rthal_rdtsc (void) {
00120     unsigned long long t;
00121     rthal_read_tsc(t);

00125 #if defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE) && !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00126 
00127 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the
00128    Xenomai domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task
00129    address using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack
00130    pointer instead. */
00131 
00132 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00133     return ((struct thread_info *)(rthal_root_domain->esp[cpuid] & (~(16384-1)UL)))->task;
00134 }
00135 
00136 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00137 
00138 {
00139     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00140     
00141     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 16384)
00142         return rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00143 
00144     return current;
00145 }
00146 
00147 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE || CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00148 
00149 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00150     return current;
00151 }
00152 
00153 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid) {
00154     return current;
00155 }
00156 
00157 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE && !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00159 static inline void rthal_timer_program_shot (unsigned long delay)
00160 {
00161     if(!delay) delay = 1;
00162     set_dec(delay);
00163 }

00175 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00176 
00177 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00178     
00179     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00180        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00181        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00182        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/hal/fpu.S). */
00183 
00184     double fpr[32];
00185     unsigned long fpscr;       /* mffs uses 64-bit (pad in hi/fpscr in lo) */
00186 } rthal_fpenv_t;
00187 
00188 void rthal_init_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00189 
00190 void rthal_save_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00191 
00192 void rthal_restore_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00193 
00194 #ifndef CONFIG_SMP
00195 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) last_task_used_math
00196 #else /* CONFIG_SMP */
00197 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) ({                             \
00198     struct task_struct * _cur = (cur);                          \
00199     ((_cur->thread.regs && (_cur->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))   \
00200      ? _cur : NULL);                                            \
00201 })
00202 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00203     
00204 #define rthal_disable_fpu() ({                          \
00205     register unsigned long _msr;                                 \
00206     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00207     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsrd %0"                   \
00208                            : /* no output */            \
00209                            : "r"(_msr & ~(MSR_FP))      \
00210                            : "memory" );                \
00211 })
00212 
00213 #define rthal_enable_fpu() ({                           \
00214     register unsigned long _msr;                                 \
00215     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00216     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsrd %0"                   \
00217                            : /* no output */            \
00218                            : "r"(_msr | MSR_FP)         \
00219                            : "memory" );                \
00220 })
00221 
00222 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
